login.two_factor_help: Open the two-factor authentication app on your device to view your authentication code and verify your identity.
login.recovery_code_msg: You can enter one of your recovery codes in case you lost access to your mobile device.
login.reset_pwd_msg: Check your email for the confirmation code
login.reset_pwd_forbidden: You are not allowed to reset your password
login.reset_pwd_no_email: Your account does not have an email address, it is not possible to reset your password by sending an email verification code
login.reset_pwd_send_email_err: Unable to send confirmation code via email
login.reset_ok_login_error: The password reset completed successfully but an unexpected error occurred while signing in
login.ip_not_allowed: Login is not allowed from this IP address
login.two_factor_required: Set up two-factor authentication, it is required for the following protocols: {{val}}

general.name_different: The new name must be different from the current name
general.html5_media_not_supported: Your browser does not support HTML5 audio/video.
general.api_key_auth_help: Allow to impersonate yourself, in REST API, using an API key
general.ip_mask_help: Comma separated IP/Mask in CIDR format, for example "192.168.1.0/24,10.8.0.100/32"
general.err_protocol_forbidden: HTTP protocol is not allowed for your user
general.pwd_login_forbidden: The password login method is not allowed for your user

general.quota_scan_started: Quota scan started. It can take a while depending on the number of files to check

general.skip_tls_verify: Skip TLS verify. This should be used only for testing

fs.invalid_name: File or folder names cannot contain "/"
fs.err_generic: Unable to access the requested resource

delete_multi.err_generic_partial: Not all the selected items have been deleted, please reload the page

upload.message: Drop files here or click to upload.
upload.err_dir_overwrite: $t(fs.upload.err_generic). There are directories with the same name as the files: {{- val}}
upload.overwrite_text: File conflict detected. Do you want to overwrite the following files?

2fa.title: Two-factor authentication using Authenticator apps
2fa.msg_info: Two-factor authentication adds an extra layer of security to your account. To log in you'll need to provide an additional authentication code.
2fa.recovery_codes_msg1: Recovery codes are a set of one time use codes that can be used in place of the authentication code to login to the web UI. You can use them if you lose access to your phone to login to your account and disable or regenerate two-factor auth configuration.
2fa.recovery_codes_msg2: To keep your account secure, don't share or distribute your recovery codes. We recommend saving them with a secure password manager.
2fa.recovery_codes_msg3: If you generate new recovery codes, you automatically invalidate old ones.
2fa.info1: SSH protocol (SFTP/SCP/SSH commands) will ask for the passcode if the client uses keyboard interactive authentication.
2fa.info2: HTTP protocol means Web UI and REST APIs. Web UI will ask for the passcode using a specific page. For REST API you have to add the passcode using an HTTP header.
2fa.info3: FTP has no standard way to support two-factor authentication, if you enable the FTP support, you have to add the TOTP passcode after the password. For example if your password is "password" and your one time passcode is "123456" you have to use "password123456" as password.
2fa.info4: WebDAV is not supported since each single request must be authenticated and a passcode cannot be reused.
2fa.setup_msg: Use your preferred Authenticator App (e.g. Microsoft Authenticator, Google Authenticator, Authy, 1Password etc. ) to scan the QR code. It will generate an authentication code for you to enter below.
2fa.setup_help: If you have trouble using the QR code, select manual entry on your app, and enter the code:
2fa.disable_question: Do you want to disable two-factor authentication?
2fa.generate_question: Do you want to generate a new secret key and invalidate the previous one? Any registered Authenticator App will stop working
2fa.recovery_codes_gen_err: Failed to generate new recovery codes
2fa.auth_code_invalid: Failed to validate the provided authentication code
2fa.no_protocol: Please select at least a protocol
2fa.required_protocols: Unable to disable two-factor authentication. The security policy configured for your account requires two-factor authentication for the following protocols: {{val}}

share.scope_help: For scope "Write" and "Read/Write" you have to define a single path and it must be a directory
share.path_help: file or directory path, i.e. /dir or /dir/file.txt
share.password_help: If set the share will be password-protected
share.max_tokens_help: Maximum number of times this share can be accessed. 0 means no limit
share.err_no_password: You are not allowed to share files/folders without password
share.expiration_out_of_range: Set an expiration date and make sure it is less than or equal to {{- val, datetime}}
share.path_required: At least a path is required
share.path_write_scope: The write scope requires exactly one path
share.expiration_past: The expiration date must be in the future
share.browsable_multiple_paths: A share with multiple paths is not browsable
share.browsable_non_dir: The share is not a directory so it is not browsable
share.link_single_desc: You can download the shared content as a single zip file
share.link_dir_desc: If the share consists of a single directory, you can browse and download files
share.link_uncompressed_desc: If the share consists of a single file, it can also be downloaded uncompressed
share.upload_desc: You can upload one or more files to the shared directory
share.expired_desc: This share is no longer accessible because it has expired
share.invalid_path: The shared directory is missing or not accessible

change_pwd.info: Enter your current password, for security reasons, and then your new password twice, to verify that you have written it correctly. You will be logged out after changing your password
change_pwd.required_fields: Please provide the current password and the new one two times
change_pwd.no_match: The two password fields do not match
change_pwd.no_different: The new password must be different from the current one
change_pwd.required: Password change is required. Set a new password to continue using your account

user.username_invalid: The specified username is not valid, the following characters are allowed: a-zA-Z0-9-_.~
user.home_invalid: The home directory must be an absolute path
user.err_primary_group: Only one primary group is allowed
user.err_permissions_generic: Invalid permissions: Make sure you use valid absolute paths
user.folder_path_required: The virtual folder mount path is required
user.folder_quota_size_invalid: The quota as size of virtual folders must be greater than or equal to -1
user.folder_quota_file_invalid: The quota as files of virtual folders must be greater than or equal to -1
user.folder_quota_invalid: Quotas as size and as number of files of virtual folders must be both -1 or greater or equal than 0
user.ip_filters_invalid: Invalid IP filters, make sure they respect CIDR notation, for example 192.168.1.0/24
user.share_expiration_invalid: The expiration for shares must be greater than or equal to the defined default value
user.file_pattern_path_invalid: File name pattern filter paths must be absolute
user.file_pattern_duplicated: Duplicated file name pattern filters detected
user.disable_active_2fa: Two-factor authentication cannot be disabled for a user with an active configuration
user.pwd_change_conflict: It is not possible to request a password change and at the same time prevent the password from being changed
user.role_help: Users with a role can be managed by global administrators and administrators with the same role
user.require_pwd_change_help: The user will need to change the password from WebClient to activate the account
user.groups_help: Groups membership impart the groups settings with the exception of membership only groups
user.template_help: For each user set the username and at least one of the password and public key
user.virtual_folders_help: Quota size/files -1 means included within user quota, 0 unlimited. Don't set -1 for shared folders. You can use MB/GB/TB suffix. Without suffix we assume bytes
user.disconnect: Disconnect the user after the update
user.disconnect_help: This way you force the user to login again, if connected, and so to use the new configuration
user.expires_in_help: Account expiration as number of days from the creation. 0 means no expiration
user.tls_cert_help: Paste your PEM encoded TLS certificate here
user.template_title: Create one or more new users from this template
user.template_help1: Placeholders will be replaced in paths and credentials of the configured storage backend.
user.template_help2: The generated users can be saved or exported. Exported users can be imported from the "Maintenance" section of this SFTPGo instance or another.

virtual_folders.quota_size_help: 0 means no limit. You can use MB/GB/TB suffix
virtual_folders.template_title: Create one or more new virtual folders from this template
virtual_folders.template_name_placeholder: replaced with the name of the specified virtual folder
virtual_folders.template_help: The generated virtual folders can be saved or exported. Exported folders can be imported from the "Maintenance" section of this SFTPGo instance or another.
virtual_folders.name: Virtual folder name

storage.title: File system
storage.label: Storage
storage.home_dir_placeholder: Absolute path to a directory on local disk
storage.home_dir_help1: Leave blank for an appropriate default
storage.home_dir_help2: Leave blank and storage to "Local disk" to not override the root directory
storage.home_dir_help3: Required for local disk storage providers. For other storage providers this folder will be used for temporary files, you can leave it blank for an appropriate default
storage.home_dir_invalid: Invalid root directory, make sure it is an absolute path
storage.sftp_home_help: Restrict access to this SFTP path. Example: "/somedir/subdir"
storage.endpoint_help: For AWS S3, leave blank to use the default endpoint for the specified region
storage.sftp_endpoint_help: Endpoint as host:port. The port is always required
storage.part_size_help: 0 means the default (5 MB). Minimum is 5
storage.ul_concurrency_help: How many parts are uploaded in parallel. 0 means the default (5)
storage.dl_concurrency_help: How many parts are downloaded in parallel. 0 means the default (5)
storage.ul_part_timeout_help: Max time limit, in seconds, to upload a single part. 0 means no limit
storage.gcs_ul_part_timeout_help: Max time limit, in seconds, to upload a single part. 0 means the default (32)
storage.dl_part_timeout_help: Max time limit, in seconds, to download a single part. 0 means no limit
storage.key_prefix_help: Restrict access to keys with the specified prefix. Example: "somedir/subdir/"
storage.role_arn_help: Optional IAM Role ARN to assume
storage.credentials_file_help: Add or update credentials from a JSON file
storage.auto_credentials_help: Use default application credentials or credentials from environment variables
storage.sas_url_help: Shared Access Signature URL can be used instead of account name/key
storage.passphrase_help: Passphrase used to derive the per-object encryption key
storage.passphrase_key_help: Passphrase used to protect your private key, if any
storage.fingerprints_help: SHA256 fingerprints to be validated when connecting to the external SFTP server, one per line. If empty any host key will be accepted: this is a security risk!
storage.sftp_buffer_help: A buffer size greater than 0 enables concurrent transfers
storage.relaxed_equality_check_help: Enable to consider only the endpoint to determine if different configurations point to the same server. By default, both the endpoint and username must match
storage.key_prefix_invalid: $t(storage.fs_error): invalid key prefix, cannot start with "/"

oidc.token_expired: Your OpenID token has expired, please log in again
oidc.token_invalid_webadmin: Your OpenID token is not valid for the WebAdmin UI. Log out of your OpenID server and log in to WebAdmin
oidc.token_invalid_webclient: Your OpenID token is not valid for the WebClient UI. Log out of your OpenID server and log in to the WebClient
oidc.role_admin_err: Incorrect OpenID role, logged in user is not an administrator
oidc.role_user_err: Incorrect OpenID role, logged in user is an administrator
oidc.get_user_err: Failed to get user associated with OpenID token

filters.password_strength_help: Values in the 50-70 range are suggested for common use cases. 0 means disabled, any password will be accepted
filters.password_expiration_help: Password expiration as number of days. 0 means no expiration
filters.default_shares_expiration_help: Default expiration for new shares as number of days
filters.max_shares_expiration_help: Maximum allowed expiration, as number of days, when a user creates or updates a share
filters.directory_permissions_help: Wildcards are supported in paths, for example "/incoming/*" matches any directory within "/incoming"
filters.directory_patterns_help: Comma separated denied or allowed files/directories, based on shell patterns. The match is case insensitive
filters.max_sessions_help: Maximun number of concurrent sessions. 0 means no limit
filters.denied_login_methods_help: "password" is valid for all supported protocols, "password-over-SSH" only for SSH/SFTP/SCP
filters.max_upload_size_help: Maximum upload size for a single file. 0 means no limit. You can use MB/GB/TB suffix
filters.upload_data_transfer_help: Maximum data transfer allowed for uploads. 0 means no limit
filters.download_data_transfer_help: Maximum data transfer allowed for downloads. 0 means no limit
filters.total_data_transfer_help: Maximum data transfer allowed for uploads + downloads. Replace the individual limits. 0 means no limit
filters.start_directory_help: Alternate initial directory to use instead of "/". Supported for SFTP/FTP/HTTP
filters.tls_username_help: Defines the TLS certificate field to use as username. Ignored if mutual TLS is disabled
filters.ftp_security_help: Ignored if TLS is already globally required for all FTP users
filters.is_anonymous_help: Anonymous users are supported for FTP and WebDAV protocols and have read-only access
filters.disable_fs_checks_help: Disable checks for existence and automatic creation of home directory and virtual folders
filters.api_key_auth_help: Allow to impersonate the user, in REST API, with an API key
filters.external_auth_cache_time_help: Cache time, in seconds, for users authenticated using an external auth hook. 0 means no cache
